‚öîÔ∏è $XRP  vs BNB: The Tightest Battle in Crypto Right Now  When you‚Äôve been in the game long enough, you know the real fights don‚Äôt always make the headlines. But this one? It should.   üî• XRP and BNB are locked in a neck-and-neck race for the top-three non-stablecoin spot ‚Äî with just ~ $1.35B separating their market caps.  As of now, $BNB  sits around $117.7B, and XRP trails at $116.36B. One decent daily move could flip the leaderboard. What‚Äôs wild is the divergence in activity: XRP is being traded harder ‚Äî $2.41B vs BNB‚Äôs $1.4B in 24h volume ‚Äî yet BNB holds a higher market cap and year-to-date performance (+31% vs. -12%).  üëâ To me, this is a narrative fight. BNB leans on infrastructure: burns, BNB Chain, exchange flows.   XRP depends on external wins: payment adoption, legal clarity, and institutional buzz.  üëÄ Who takes the edge? Whoever delivers the next catalyst first. And I‚Äôll be watching it live.  #Altcoin Season#  #BNBChain#  #XRP

The full financial stack is being rebuilt onchain.

This week, from Coinbase to J.P. Morgan to Standard Chartered, major institutions rolled out tokenized products at production scale.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Coinbase expands into stock trading and prediction markets

2Ô∏è‚É£ J.P. Morgan steps further into crypto with tokenized money fund

https://t.co/Yb3bgxVtoN

3Ô∏è‚É£ Standard Chartered launches tokenized deposit solution with Ant International

The solution is live in production and supports HKD, CNH, USD, and SGD. Ant can now move money around the globe instantly and 24/7 between its worldwide intragroup entities.

https://t.co/XplfPpNWab

4Ô∏è‚É£ SBI plans regulated yen stablecoin for global settlement

The stablecoin aims to plug Japan into onchain finance and enhance cross-border tokenized asset flows under the country's new Financial Services Agency (FSA) regime.

https://t.co/zB45xtySmp

5Ô∏è‚É£ Ondo tokenized stocks are coming to Solana

In early 2026, Ondo Global Markets will launch on Solana, bringing 100+ tokenized stocks and ETFs to Solana‚Äôs internet capital markets.

https://t.co/OruJv271p8

6Ô∏è‚É£ Ondo Bridge for onchain securities is live

Now live on Ethereum and BNB Chain, the Ondo Bridge enables cross-chain transfers for 100+ tokenized stocks and ETFs.

https://t.co/FPaLGOrtfy

BNB Holds Flat +0.02% in Current 4H Candle as Price Stabilizes in Downtrend üîó  $BNB  is trading at 865.63 USDT, up +1.36% in the past 24 hours ‚Äî showing modest gains in the exchange token sector with steady volume amid broader market recovery led by Bitcoin.  On the 4H chart, $BNB  remains in a downtrend since early December, trading below the descending EMA ribbon and near the lower Bollinger Band around 864‚Äì866 USDT. Recent price action displays a flat/doji-like candle after a minor bounce from lows near 864.79, with volume low and buy pressure at 16% indicating dominant selling sentiment but some support holding at current levels.  The structure stays bearish with lower highs and lower lows intact, while Bollinger Bands are narrowing ‚Äî hinting at reduced volatility and potential consolidation or squeeze setup. RSI hovers neutral in the lower range without bullish divergence.  üìà If $BNB  breaks above 870.89 USDT with increasing volume, recovery could target 880‚Äì900 USDT (prior resistance and psychological levels). üìâ Below 864 USDT, downside may accelerate toward 845‚Äì830 USDT, testing deeper support.  üìä BingX Chart: BNB/USDT (4H)  #Altcoin Season#  #CMC Quest: Earn Rewards#  #CMC Launch: Aster#

Stablecoin Flow Snapshot

In the last 24 hours, stablecoin liquidity clearly rotated rather than entering the market evenly.  $TON  absorbed the strongest inflow, signaling early positioning and fresh capital interest. Tron remained slightly positive, suggesting steady usage-based flow rather than aggressive speculation.

Meanwhile, $BNB  Chain, Solana, Arbitrum, and Base saw net outflows. This usually reflects capital being redeployed, not panic selling. Liquidity moves first, price follows later. Watching these flows gives a much earlier signal than candles alone.

As 2025 wraps up, we‚Äôre handing the mic to the community to spotlight builders who have been consistently building on BNB Chain.

To participate, comment directly below to this post by tagging one project you think deserves a spot on Santa‚Äôs Builder List.

To spread the Christmas cheer, we‚Äôll also be giving 5 random participants the chance to win a share of 1 BNB.

How it works
üî∏ Period: Dec 22 - Dec 29, 2025

üî∏ Winners will be selected via a random draw tool (e.g. Simpliers), and prizes will be distributed shortly thereafter.

2025 pushed DeFi further along its maturity curve, with discernible credit cycles, growing institutional inflows, and increasingly robust trading venues.

Here are 6 major DeFi trends in 2025 üßµüëá 
1/ Lending remains the largest DeFi category by TVL.

Onchain credit grew 37% YTD, outperforming BTC and ETH PA but lagging stablecoin supply growth.

This reflects a market shifting from risk aversion to risk-on behaviour, then to noticeable deleveraging in Q4. 
2/ While Aave strengthened its dominance with a market share of 57%, challengers gained ground.

Morpho scaled through Coinbase integration and overtook Spark as the 2nd-largest lending platform. Maple packaged private credit into a yield-bearing stablecoin. 
3/ Tokenized public-market RWA value tripled to $17b YTD, marking the strongest expansion the sector has seen since inception.

BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL emerged as the reserve asset underpinning a new class of onchain cash products, including Ethena‚Äôs USDtb and Ondo‚Äôs OUSG. 
4/ Perp DEX to CEX volume ratio tripled to 19% YTD, reflecting major improvements in execution speed, liquidity depth, and overall UX.

Hyperliquid remained the incumbent, but well-funded entrants like Lighter and Aster used incentives to challenge its lead. 
5/ Prediction market volume reached ATH in Q4 after experiencing a slowdown post-US election.

Both Polymarket and Kalshi raised 9-figure funding rounds in 2025, signalling growing institutional conviction in event contracts as an emerging derivatives category. 
6/ Spot DEX volume stagnated.

Solana‚Äôs memecoin-driven activity collapsed, while BNB Chain absorbed a larger share of retail speculation.

Spot DEX to CEX volume ratio hovered below 20%, indicating that the structural efficiency gap in spot trading remains largely unchanged. 
Sum/ Taken together, 2025 showed DeFi progressing toward a more durable equilibrium, with maturing primitives and expanding institutional alignment laying the groundwork for broader growth ahead.
fin/ For a full breakdown of the development and trends of DeFi and other crypto sectors, check out 2026 Digital Assets Outlook Report by @TheBlock__ üëá

And a big thank you to @GK8_Security for sponsoring the report!

Crypto Markets Rally Ahead of the Holidays üéÑ  Bitcoin and Ethereum climbed over 2% as markets rebounded into Christmas.  BTC +2.5% ‚Üí $90,125 ETH +3.2% ‚Üí $3,060 SOL +3.3%, $BNB  +2.3%, XRP +2.2% Market cap hits $3.13T (+2%)  Altcoins led the charge with SKY +6.7% and NEAR +6.2%, while liquidations topped $207M, mostly shorts.  Despite the rally, BTC & ETH ETFs saw notable outflows, keeping traders cautious as volatility simmers beneath the surface.

BREAKING: ‚ö†Ô∏è $BNB  lags despite market gains amid fresh scrutiny.  Binance's token rallies but underperforms as concerns surface, despite breaking key resistance.  $BNB  broke $860, yet faced headwinds amid reports of Binance's alleged failure to prevent suspicious transactions. This comes after agreeing to a $4 .3 billion settlement with the U.S. government. Trading volume surged, signaling strong interest. Despite positive price action, $BNB  underperformed the wider crypto market as other exchange tokens show more resilience. Another token saw gains. #BNB  #Binance  #CryptoNews  #MarketAnalysis
